title: Bisbis (Regulus maderensis)
body: The smallest of the birds in Madeira and the only one that is peculiar to it. It frequents the heather and laurel woods in the interior and constructs a very artful ovoid-shaped nest made of moss. The laying usually takes place from May to July and can consist of up to 7 eggs of a reddish-brown color, with red spots or marks.
